p: Could outbreaks be determined by the ability of available vectors to transmit the virus? Vector competence studies showed that Ae. aegypti from NC is competent for DENV, ZIKV and CHIKV. The Extrinsic Incubation Period, however, is three days for CHIKV [ 5], seven days for DENV [ 6] and nine days for ZIKV [ 7]. Furthermore, transmission efficiencies at 14 days post-infection are 30% for CHIKV [ 5], <10% for DENV [ 6] and 5% for ZIKV [ 7]. Although transmission efficiency was highest for CHIKV, this virus never caused major outbreaks in NC.
